column1: #text=Why buy a book when you can borrow one from the library ?
#text=Your local library has a wealth of resources just waiting for you to explore .
#text=Before you check anything out , you will need a library card .
#text=Typically , you will need to prove who you are and where you live .
#text=Your drivers license will probably work for that .
#text=Go to your local library and get a card .
#text=Once you have done that , you are ready to check things out !
#text=The library is divided into different categories .
#text=One area will be fiction , which is also occasionally broken down into smaller departments .
#text=Non-fiction is divided by the type of book .
#text=There is reference , gardening , crafting , home repair , history , science , cooking , parenting , and any other subject you can imagine .
#text=When you have found a book you want , either by browsing the aisles or by searching through the card catalog , select it and take it to the front desk .
#text=They will scan your card and let you take the book home for a week or two !
